result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:09 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Robert J. Czerwinski in court, in custody.  Attorney Kees for attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Robert J. Czerwinski. 
Atty Kees requests a new date in this matter and updates the court with status.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

dated 10-25-2022, filed by Atty. Amanda Nimmer requesting to reschedule the matter

**Reviewed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on 10-26-2022: The matter shall remain as scheduled due to victim notification. Counsel may appear by video conferencing.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, unless through respective attorneys in the family court action.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1 mile of Victim A, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

3:20 PM Defendant Robert J. Czerwinski in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Robert J. Czerwinski. Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant is currently on a probation and parole hold.
Hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
